title: 2 arrested after teen shot at Mount Laurel home
content:
MOUNT LAUREL A 17-year-old boy was hospitalized after accidentally being shot in the chest at his home by a visitor who mishandled a gun, police said.
Mount Laurel police responded to a home in the 3300 block of Marne Highway at 11:16 p.m. and found the teen with a gunshot wound to the chest. The wound was not life-threatening, and the unidentified victim was treated at Cooper University Hospital in Camden, police said.
"The victim initially reported that he was sitting on his porch when he was shot by an unknown masked suspect who then ran off," police said in a statement Sunday. But the teen's story turned out to be a lie, police said.
Officers found two other teens walking in the area: 18-year-old Kurtis M. Cercone of Mount Laurel and a 17-year-old Trenton boy. Investigators determined both were with the victim when he was shot.
"They were handling a handgun that the two had brought with them," police said. "The gun discharged, striking the victim in the chest. The two fled the residence with the gun prior to police arrival."
Police said they found two handguns in Cercone's vehicle, which was in a nearby parking lot.
Cercone was held on $50,000 bail in Burlington County Jail after police charged him with weapons possession offenses. The Trenton teen was held in Burlington County Juvenile Detention Center on charges of aggravated assault, possession of a weapon for unlawful purpose and unlawful possession of a firearm.
Authorities said no one else was injured in the incident.
